summary: This is an email chain from May 6, 2020, discussing a New York Law Journal article by Evan Barr that reported on statements made by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman regarding Prince Andrew's cooperation in the Epstein investigation. Berman disputes the characterization that his remarks about Prince Andrew were part of his prepared remarks, stating they were in response to a reporter's question, and requests a correction.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The email quotes his public statement from March 9, 2020, regarding Prince Andrew's lack of cooperation in the Epstein investigation, and he is disputing how the statement was characterized in a news article.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Referenced in Berman's public remarks as having offered to cooperate via press release but then shutting the door on voluntary cooperation regarding Epstein's co-conspirators.

persons.name: Evan Barr
persons.role: Journalist for New York Law Journal
persons.context: Author of the New York Law Journal article titled 'The Prince and the Proffer' which reported on Berman's remarks and is the subject of the correction request.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, publicly commented on Prince Andrew's lack of cooperation with the investigation into Epstein's co-conspirators.

events.title: Berman's Press Conference Remarks
events.description: At a press conference, U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman stated that contrary to Prince Andrew's public offer to cooperate, he had 'completely shut the door on voluntary cooperation' and that his office was 'considering its options.'

events.title: Publication of NYLJ Article
events.description: Evan Barr publishes an article in the New York Law Journal titled 'The Prince and the Proffer' reporting on Berman's March 9 remarks.

keyFacts: On March 9, 2020, U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman publicly stated that Prince Andrew had 'completely shut the door on voluntary cooperation' with the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirators.
Berman's office was 'considering its options' regarding Prince Andrew's lack of cooperation.
A May 6, 2020, New York Law Journal article by Evan Barr characterized Berman's remarks as part of his 'prepared remarks' at a press conference.
Berman disputes this characterization in an email, stating the remarks were made in response to a reporter's question, and requests a correction to the article.
